Analysis Result Builder

Source: R/result_builder.R
build_analysis_result.Rd

Standardized constructor for analysis result objects. Ensures consistent structure across all analysis functions in consumeR.

Usage

build_analysis_result(
  test_type,
  test_name,
  core_stats,
  specific_stats = list(),
  assumptions = NULL,
  interpretation = NULL,
  publication_text = NULL,
  alpha = 0.05,
  ...
)

Arguments

test_type

Character. Short identifier (e.g., "t_test", "anova")

test_name

Character. Human-readable name (e.g., "Independent Samples T-Test")

core_stats

List. Must contain at minimum: p_value, n

specific_stats

List. Test-specific statistics (e.g., t_statistic, df)

assumptions

assumptions_result object or NULL

interpretation

Character. Plain language interpretation

publication_text

Character or NULL. APA7 formatted text

alpha

Numeric. Significance threshold (default: 0.05)

...

Additional fields to include

Value

S3 object with classes c("<test_type>_result", "analysis_result", "list") with standardized field ordering and validation

See also

Other infrastructure: .apa7_templates, check_test_assumptions()

Examples

result <- build_analysis_result(
  test_type = "t_test",
  test_name = "Independent Samples T-Test",
  core_stats = list(p_value = 0.042, n = 100),
  specific_stats = list(t_statistic = 2.05, df = 98),
  interpretation = "Groups differ significantly"
)
